question: Which of the following is/ are the consequences of the Treat of Maratha with the Mughals during the time of Balaji Biswanath?
option1: The Mughals lost their control over Deccan
option2: Marathas started intervening in the politics of Delhi
option3: Marathas were allowed to collect Chauth and Sardeshmukhi
explanation: The consequences of the Treat of Maratha with the Mughals in the year 1714- The Mughals lost their control over Deccan, Marathas started intervening in the politics of Delhi and Balaji Bswanath started supporting the Sayyad Brothers. Marathas were allowed to collect Chauth and Sardeshmukhi from some of the Mughal provinces of the South.
